channel.title: Mark Mccahill on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: How twitter and gopher were born, (or) why you should make it work on the worst system first
item.description: this post on "how twitter was born" is making the rounds; thanks to Prentiss Riddle for alerting me to it.   The best quote from it is the use case that involves the worst possible internet device in the world: text messages from a mobile phone. I remember that @Jack’s first use case was city-related: telling people that the club he’s at is happening. “I want to have a dispatch service that connects us on our phones using text.
